Asher is a proven, high-integrity leader who has taken the Dingman Center to new heights, as one of the leading entrepreneurship centers in the USA.  He is a creative, execution-oriented entrepreneur who understands all facets of business building from capital formation to operations.  He has expanded Dingman's realm into China via the first-ever national business plan competition which received televised coverage; into capital raising for regional start-ups; and into directly investing in and incubating companies.   It has been a pleasure to work with Asher and help contribute to the University of Maryland community and well as the regional entrepreneurship and venture commnunitiy.

summary: I am an experienced business operator creating, implementing and managing new initiatives with a structured and scalable approach.From 2004-12 I was the managing director of the Dingman Center for Entrepreneurship at the University of Maryland. During that time I advised or invested in more than 100 startups and worked on over 50 technology commercialization projects in the US, Israel and China. I developed and managed the Center's strategy and operations including business incubation, technology commercialization, global programs and startup funding services focused on local entrepreneurs, faculty and students across campus.
